name: Youth Arts Mentorship at Colborne Lodge
description:
Colborne Lodge presents "Bits and Pieces"- the vibrant voices of 8 young Toronto artists under the mentorship of Desiree Mckenzie. The youth artists layer ideas of HOME through collage and poetry. 

Celebrate the creativity, passion and stories of youth in a series of eight inspiring installations across the city at Toronto History Museum sites. These installations are produced under the Youth Arts Mentorship program, which empowers emerging talent to experience self-discovery and artistic expression through visual arts.

name: Queer Emo Nite TO Holi-Gays Edition V.19
description:
Toronto's queerest, saddest and wildest party, bring your most fabulous outfits down to the mosh pit and make some new queer sad friends!

Come party to your favourite emo tunes, queer anthems, and of course, two performance sets by the one and only Seyonce Knows!

name: Hanukkah Ball
description:
Celebrate the festival of lights with us! 

Get ready for a night filled with joy, laughter and dancing.

name: Miracle On 34th St: A Live Radio Play
description:
Developed from scripts by Lux Radio Theatre and The Screen Director's Playhouse.

Step back into the 1940s and experience the holiday classic as audiences once did â€” through the charm and imagination of old-time radio.

In this unique stage version, our actors perform multiple characters AND create every sound effect live onstage, from jingling sleigh bells to vehicles winding through the streets. Accompanied by a live musical score.

It's nostalgic. It's magical. And it's the perfect way to welcome the season.

Come join us and find the Christmas Spirit, old school style.

name: Handel Messiah
description:
It just wouldn't be the holiday season without Messiah! 

There's a reason why Tafelmusik returns to this classic each year to celebrate the festive season! Written in just 24 days, this uplifting oratorio surges with emotion, drama, and poignancy. 

With its message of charity, peace, and goodwill, Messiah reminds us of our common humanity, transcending cultural, geographic, and religious boundaries. Join us.
